Aigamuxa.name: Aigamuxa
Aigamuxa.publicNotes:
Aigamuxas are towering humanoids that stalk arid deserts in search of prey. Carnivorous and voracious, they hunt anything that moves but especially relish eating sentient creatures. Many Mwangi people incorrectly refer to aigamuxas as demons, while others more accurately describe them as having descended from giants. Aigamuxas resemble large humans with smooth hollows where their eyes should be, but their eyes are actually embedded in the soles of their feet. They sport long, sharp claws and teeth that they use to tear their prey apart once they catch them. A moving aigamuxa's odd gait resembles dancing more than a typical walk or run, but its speed is alarming, if difficult to correctly estimate at a distance.

An aigamuxa's unique physiology makes catching prey difficult, and most aigamuxas are constantly hungry. When pursuing prey, an aigamuxa must occasionally stop to lift its feet in order to regain their bearings. Most stand on their hands while looking around, which allows them to immediately backflip back into a run. An aigamuxa's eyes are generally resistant to the sands of their native desert habitats, but irritants such as chilies or caltrops can seriously impair their hunting ability, and desert travelers often carry a bag of these in case they need to deal with an aigamuxa.

Clever aigamuxas know that attacking wandering prey can be very dangerous, instead using their powerful hands to dig deep into sand dunes or dirt and wait to ambush passersby. Aigamuxas are particularly good at hiding in their home environments, and unfortunate travelers often don't notice the barely visible eyes of an aigamuxa until it's too late.

Limited Vision.name: Limited Vision
Limited Vision.description: An aigamuxa's eyes are located on the bottom of their feet, making it difficult for them to see. An aigamuxa is typically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{blind}. If they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, they can see normally until the end of their turn.

Weak Feet.name: Weak Feet
Weak Feet.description: If an aigamuxa takes damage from Striding or Stepping into hazardous terrain or a square with similar grounded hazards (such as caltrops), they can't Seek until the end of their next turn.

Burrowed Ambush.name: Burrowed Ambush
Burrowed Ambush.description:
需求 The aigamuxa is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding} in dirt, sand, or another soft surface

效果 The aigamuxa makes a claw Strike against a creature within reach. On a hit, the aigamuxa automatically Grabs the creature. Whether or not they hit, the aigamuxa then Strides. If they have a creature grabbed, the creature moves with the aigamuxa.

Burrowing Concealment.name: Burrowing Concealment
Burrowing Concealment.description:
需求 The aigamuxa is standing on dirt, sand, or another soft surface

效果 The aigamuxa quickly digs into the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hides}. They leave their feet partially exposed, allowing them to see out from the surface. The aigamuxa can hold their breath for up to 10 minutes while hiding in this way.

Anadi Elder.name: 半蛛人长老 Anadi Elder
Anadi Elder.publicNotes:
半蛛人长老通常必须做出艰难的选择，是继续谈判，还是将分歧升级为彻底的冲突。

半蛛人是爱好和平、避世隐居的类人生物，生活在森林、丛林和其他未被征服的荒野深处。它们的真实形态很像半人半蜘蛛，身上有五颜六色的美丽而独特的斑纹。这些图案就像别的类人生物的面部、胎记等其他特征一样独特。

半蛛人天生就具有制造幻觉和变形的天赋。它们很久以前就知道自己的真实形态会遭到其它类人生物的厌恶，因此常常以类人生物的形态示人。当他们伪装成类人生物的时候，他们漆黑的眼睛里会闪烁一种奇怪的、可爱的光泽，以及下意识的小动作会暗示他们并非表面看起来的那样简单。由于他们已经习惯了类人生物对蜘蛛的敏感态度，大多数半蛛人都觉得向陌生人展示自己的真实形态是不礼貌的表现。

大多数半蛛人只有在面临危险时才会变为蜘蛛形态，并将此作为一种吓退敌人的策略。如果被迫进入战斗——大多数半蛛人都不愿如此——他们会尽快变成真实形态，这样就能对敌人施加毁灭性的毒液。

Asanbosam.name: 铁牙懒 Asanbosam
Asanbosam.publicNotes:
铁牙懒是一种巨大的、毛茸茸的类人生物，拥有一幅寒铁牙齿和强壮的长着钩状尖爪的四肢。他们喜欢躲在树顶，从上方割开不幸的猎物的喉咙，让其流血致死。附近地区的人们流传着这些关于“吸血的树上人”的恐怖故事，经验丰富的丛林探险家在途径铁牙懒的地盘时会时刻密切关注每棵树的树梢。

铁牙懒的饮食需要大量的铁（通常以血液的形式来摄入），以此来维持它那副寒铁牙齿的完整性。在不狩猎也不交配的时候，铁牙懒会通过花费时间咀嚼某种岩石来磨利自己的牙齿。

一些民间传说表明，铁牙懒存在的历史非常悠久，几乎和寒铁的起源一样古老，并且地下的寒铁矿脉其实就是古代铁牙懒的埋葬坑。勇敢或愚蠢的偷猎者常常潜入铁牙懒的领土捕猎这些怪物，希望能收获成袋的珍贵牙齿。

Attack from Above.name: 上方攻击 Attack from Above
Attack from Above.description:
需求 铁牙懒位于目标正上方的位置；

效果 他进行一次触及增加到15尺的爪抓打击。此打击造成额外[[/r (1d6)[slashing]]]{1d6挥砍伤害}，如果命中的话，铁牙懒可以攫抓目标并且将其拉到自己相邻的空间。

这在计算铁牙懒的多重攻击减值时视为2次攻击。

Drink Blood.name: 吸血 Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
需求 一个被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}、被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}或自愿的生物位于铁牙懒的牙咬触及范围内。

效果 铁牙懒用牙齿咬住该生物，吸食它的血液。如果受害者被擒抱，则自动成功，否则铁牙懒必须尝试一次运动检定来对抗受害者的强韧DC。受害者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}，铁牙懒获得10 HP，超过生命值上限的部分将转化为临时生命值。

对已经陷入流失状态的受害者进行吸血会增加流失状态值1点，但是铁牙懒本身不会获得更多的生命值。

受害者的流失状态值每周减少1点。如果有献血者或者足够的血浆，通过@Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Drink Blood Treatment]检定对受害者进行输血，可以在10分钟后减少受害者的流失状态值1点。

Biloko Veteran.name: 鳄吻老兵 Biloko Veteran
Biloko Veteran.publicNotes:
斩获足够多战利品的鳄吻老兵能赢得同伴的尊重和畏惧。

鳄吻精是长着鳄鱼嘴的精类，他们在芒吉莽原出没，以人类的肉为食。鳄吻精邪恶狡猾，他们使用致命的陷阱和游击狩猎战术来捕捉猎物——通常是倒霉的探险者或误入丛林的村民，他们中的许多人认为鳄吻精是残忍的先祖之魂。这些生物中最强大的被称为“鳄吻怪”，拥有强大的变形魔法。

鳄吻精对铃铛情有独钟，敲钟的声音往往预示着附近有鳄吻精出没。除了在外出打猎时携带和敲响铃铛外，鳄吻精有时还会用强大的魔法为铃铛附魔，或者将铃铛挂在绳子上作为营地的警报器。

鳄吻精看起来像细长但结实的类人生物，有着鳄鱼般的脑袋、铁锈色的皮肤和血红色的眼睛。他们只吃人形生物的肉，并且他们只吃一顿就能存活很长时间，这要归功于他们像蛇一样吞下整个中型人形生物的能力。他们会松开下颚骨，然后把受害者从头到脚慢慢吞下。多亏了他们酸性的唾液和锋利的牙齿，鳄吻精可以将食物咀嚼成易于消化的肉糜，甚至在吞咽时也能将肉和骨头磨成浓缩的糊状物；因此，它们在吞食两倍或三倍于自身大小的食物时不会犹豫。

刚饱餐一顿的鳄吻精很容易通过肿胀下坠的腹部识别出来。然而，尽管它们此时看起来移动缓慢，但危险性也不亚于平时，因为它们钟情于杀戮，并且可能有饥饿的同伴躲在附近等待另一顿大餐。

Inspired Feast.name: 盛宴 Inspired Feast
Inspired Feast.description:
如果鳄吻精花费1分钟以上的时间来吞食一具人类尸体，他们的攻击骰获得+1状态加值，伤害骰获得+2状态加值，持续1小时。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.EM0VP31B8CyjFD15]{效果: 盛宴}

Swipe.name: 猛击 Swipe
Swipe.description:
老兵进行一次近战打击，并将检定结果与两个敌人的AC进行比较，每个敌人都必须在近战触及范围内且彼此相邻。老兵只投掷一次伤害骰，对每个被击中的生物施加伤害。

一次猛击在计算老兵的多重攻击减值时视作2次攻击。

Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan.name: 查咯安加赞助祭 Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan
Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan.publicNotes:
即便猩猩王已经陨落，一些查咯猿人依然崇拜着安加赞。

传说表示查咯猿人与恶魔领主安加赞（Angazhan）有着共同的祖先，安加赞改造了哪些曾经试图反抗其邪教的人类的身体，由此创造了第一只查咯猿人。有传言说，查咯猿人的祭司们为了纪念这个古老的起源，改进了某种可怕的仪式，迫使哪些被其杀死的凡人转化为新的查咯猿人。其他的故事表明，某种用来敬拜安加赞的强大图腾拥有这样的力量，在这些魔法神器前面进行祭祀仪式，就能让死者的灵魂作为野蛮和毁灭之主安加赞的暴力信徒复活。

不久前，大多数查咯猿人还团结在猩猩王鲁萨泽克（Ruthazek the Gorilla King）的旗下。鲁萨泽克是个强大的军阀，是安加赞的忠实信徒，统治着乌萨罗（Usaro）。但当冒险者挑战并打败了鲁萨泽克之后，查咯猿人分裂了，各个氏族分散在丛林各处，各自都由一个强大的军阀领导。

Shrieking Frenzy.name: 暴怒尖啸 Shrieking Frenzy
Shrieking Frenzy.description:
触发 查咯猿人的回合开始。

频率 每小时一次

效果 查咯猿人获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}状态，直到它的下一回合结束，并且他可以用此额外动作打击或行走。

在狂怒生效期间，由于查咯猿人不断大声嚎叫，因此无法说话，隐秘检定也会自动失败。

Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: 精通投掷武器 Thrown Weapon Mastery
Thrown Weapon Mastery.description:
查咯猿人的投掷武器获得“致命D6”特征。

此外，如果查咯猿人投掷一件临时武器，既不会因此受到-2减值，也不会因为投掷一件具有非致命特征的临时武器来造成致命伤害而受到减值。

Charau-ka Butcher.name: 查咯屠夫 Charau-ka Butcher
Charau-ka Butcher.publicNotes:
虽然查咯猿人以其残忍而闻名，但有些人对暴力的痴迷连同类都害怕。这些致命的屠夫精通给敌人造成恶毒、血腥伤口的艺术，他们认为除了查咯猿人之外的任何人都是敌人。 一口敌人的血可以赋予他们可怕的力量，就好像查咯屠夫真的从受害者的痛苦中获得了力量。

Blood Fury.name: 血怒 Blood Fury
Blood Fury.description:
触发 查咯屠夫对一个生物造成流血伤害。

效果 查咯猿人舔舐武器上的血迹，陷入狂怒。他恢复5HP，并且直到他回合结束前，他的攻击骰获得+1状态加值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.LOLoQpaAp5cC0hbm]{效果: 血怒}

Mauler.name: 拳手 Mauler
Mauler.description: 当查咯屠夫在狂暴状态下，他的近战打击造成额外@Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success]。

Rage.name: 狂暴 Rage
Rage.description:
需求 查咯屠夫并未@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}或狂暴。

查咯屠夫唤起内心的怒意，开始狂暴。查咯屠夫获得等于你的等级+体质调整值的临时生命值。狂暴持续1分钟，或者直到没有查咯屠夫能发现的敌人存在，又或者直到查咯屠夫失去意识，以先发生的情况为准。查咯屠夫无法主动停止狂暴。在狂暴期间：

  • 查咯屠夫用近战武器或非武装攻击可造成额外2点伤害。若查咯屠夫的武器或无武装攻击有灵巧特征，此额外伤害减半。
  • 查咯屠夫的AC受到-1减值。
  • 查咯屠夫无法采取具有专注特征但不具有狂暴特征的行动。查咯屠夫可以在狂暴时进行搜索。

在查咯屠夫停止狂暴后，查咯屠夫失去狂暴赋予的所有临时生命值，并且在1分钟内无法再次狂暴。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{效果: 狂暴}

Charau-ka Warrior.name: 查咯勇士 Charau-ka Warrior
Charau-ka Warrior.publicNotes:
查咯勇士随身携带匕首、短柄斧和类似的武器，并且普通的石块在他们手里也能变成致命的武器。

Grootslang.name: 古鲁刺朗象蛇 Grootslang
Grootslang.publicNotes:
虽然第一眼很容易将古鲁刺朗象蛇认成大象，但一旦它身体的全貌被看见，这种生物就如同被一条足以吞下一整栋楼的大蛇从内部操纵着的一个怪诞的木偶。一条古鲁刺朗象蛇直立可达20英尺高，拥有如同板鳞甲一般的皮肤与一对硕大的前臂，那显眼的六根獠牙能够不费吹灰之力刺穿血肉与骨骼。它身体的其余部分可长达60英尺。古鲁刺朗象蛇的脸类似大象，但和它的蛇形表亲一样，它可以将下颌脱臼从而囫囵吞下猎物。

遭遇到古鲁刺朗象蛇的人存在微薄的可能与其讲道理或贿赂这头巨兽，这或许能够免于一死。然而一屋子的宝石也未必能够破财消灾，而一条特别残暴的古鲁刺朗象蛇也可能在收到贡品之后再反悔。

Deep Breath.name: 深呼吸 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: 古鲁刺朗象蛇能够屏息1小时。

Aquatic Elusion.name: 水遁 Aquatic Elusion
Aquatic Elusion.description:
需求 古鲁刺朗象蛇完全浸没在水中；

效果 古鲁刺朗象蛇传送到1英里范围内的另一处足以承载古鲁刺朗象蛇的水体中。

Defensive Coil.name: 防守缠结 Defensive Coil
Defensive Coil.description: 古鲁刺朗象蛇将身体蜷缩成环状。它获得20点对物理伤害的抗力直到下回合开始。

Swallow Whole.name: 活吞 Swallow Whole
Swallow Whole.description:
仅限啃咬, 超大型, [[/r (3d12+10)[bludgeoning]]]伤害, 破裂37

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Thunderous Slam.name: 雷霆猛击 Thunderous Slam
Thunderous Slam.description:
古鲁刺朗象蛇对一个触及范围内的生物进行一次脚踩打击。

不论攻击是否命中，古鲁刺朗象蛇周围10尺内的生物必须进行一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物直到他的回合结束变为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}并受到[[/r 2d8[bludgeoning]]]伤害。

大失败 同失败，但生物受到[[/r 4d8[bludgeoning]]]伤害。

K'nonna.name: K'nonna
K'nonna.publicNotes:
K'nonna are half human-and only half, in the most literal sense. They most often resemble the right half of a human, and less frequently the left half, split perfectly down the middle starting at the crown of their head. They accordingly have one eye, one ear, one arm, one leg, half of a nose, and half of a mouth full of razor-sharp teeth. A faint shimmer in the air, like the waves over a hot stone, hints at where their other half would be.

Despite the bizarre appearance of the k'nonna, they have no trouble balancing or performing everyday tasks that might be impeded by missing half of their bodies. They are extremely dexterous, able to perform complex tasks with only a single hand. The nature of their missing half has so far defied explanation; it is not invisible, nor does it exist on another plane, yet it seems to exert enough force for a k'nonna to walk like a human being.

No one is certain of the k'nonna's origins, except that they are not of this world and not descended from any known mortal creature. Banishment magic has no effect on them, implying they do not come from another plane. They are intelligent but difficult to communicate with-they speak only in half words and hear only half of what anyone says. K'nonna are also much less interested in talking than eating, and humanoids happen to be their favorite meal. The remains of a k'nonna's victim are unmistakable, as they only consume half the body.

Stories tell of the half-people's love for gifts, especially jewelry. Offerings of rings and necklaces easily distract a k'nonna long enough for prey to escape. Particularly bold victims might try to trick a k'nonna into wearing a bracelet that binds their one visible wrist or ankle to immobilize them, though the tactic is not foolproof, as a k'nonna displeased with their gifts will hunt the person who displeased them for the rest of their days.

Gilded Fascination.name: Gilded Fascination
Gilded Fascination.description:
When offered a gift worth at least 50 gp, the k'nonna must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20] saving throw; if the gift is worth at least 100 gp, the DC is instead @Check[type:will|dc:25|name:Gilded Fascination (Higher)].

If they fail the save, the k'nonna accepts the gift, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn, and cannot attack while fascinated. On a critical failure, the fascination lasts for 1 minute.

Offering a gift is an Interact action, and offering multiple gifts in the same round has no additional effect.

Half Steps.name: Half Steps
Half Steps.description: Even though k'nonna are split in half, they still move and Stride as though they have two arms and legs. However, binding just one wrist or ankle leaves them incapable of using that limb, as if it were bound to another.

Half-Speaker.name: Half-Speaker
Half-Speaker.description:
A k'nonna can communicate easily with other k'nonna, but when communicating with other creatures, only half of the spoken words make sense.

In order to convey information to a k'nonna or understand what they're saying, a non-k'nonna must succeed at a @Check[type:perception|dc:20] check.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The k'nonna Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the k'nonna began this action hidden, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Kaava Stalker.name: Kaava Stalker
Kaava Stalker.publicNotes:
Kaava hunting parties can number in the dozens, although they blend easily into the forest and cover all traces of their passage. While community elders assign various tasks to hunting parties, such as recovering food or deterring intruders, the parties are expected to accomplish these tasks as they see fit.

Kaava are stealthy, jungle-dwelling humanoids with short down feathers that can easily be mistaken for fur from a distance. Kaava have tough scales beneath these feathers. Both the scales and feathers have mutable pigmentation that allows a kaava to blend into surrounding foliage like a chameleon.

Trackless.name: Trackless
Trackless.description: A kaava moving at half their Speed or less steps so lightly that they leave virtually no trace. The DCs of checks to Track a kaava are increased by 10.

Skulking Attack.name: Skulking Attack
Skulking Attack.description: If a kaava stalker starts their turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by a creature, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} against the Kaava's attacks until the end of the turn.

Karina.name: Karina
Karina.publicNotes:
Karinas-also known as plague birds-are large owl-like creatures with dark red feathers, powerful talons, and unsettling eyes. Their broad wings conceal a pair of wiry humanoid arms that end in clawed fingers, which they use to dig through burial sites in search of corpses. The fell purpose of this is still a mystery, though most believe that karinas make off with these dead bodies to consume them in the safety of their lairs. The difficulty of tracking the beasts, as well as the danger, makes it difficult to know for sure.

A karina's terrifying appearance suggests that they're not natural creatures. Many legends claim that karinas first flew out of Abaddon to the Material Plane to consume the corpses of the first mortals, while others state that the first karina was born from the soul of the first mortal who partook in cannibalism. The power of good repulses karinas, suggesting an evil or fiendish origin.

Karinas are plague carriers and intentionally attack creatures to spread their own personal pestilence. The supernatural disease they carry, known as grave blight, causes fever, disorientation, and (at later stages) an innate desire to attack others and spread the disease. Karinas revel in the slow collapse of villages, lurking in the surrounding jungle to observe every miserable moment. As the locals bury their dead, the karinas swoop in to steal the corpses.

In addition to carrying a terrible disease, karinas also have the ability to mimic voices. They typically repeat phrases they've heard, but twist the voice into a fiendish corruption of the original. Intelligent enough to recognize the friends and family of a possible target, a karina will use the mocking voice of a loved one to frighten them. When terrorizing a village, they generally work together in groups of two or three.

Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
Sound Imitation.description: A karina who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic any voice they have heard. They have a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Grave Blight.name: Grave Blight
Grave Blight.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

阶段1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

阶段2 [[/r (1d6)[poison]]]{1d6毒素伤害}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

阶段3 [[/r (1d8)[poison]]]{1d8毒素伤害}, every hour the victim must succeed at another Fortitude save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Mocking Cry.name: Mocking Cry
Mocking Cry.description:
The Karina mimics a voice and mocks a creature within 30 feet. They attempt a Deception check to Demoralize the creature.

Regardless of whether the check succeeds, the target creature is temporarily immune to the Karina's Mocking Cry for 1 hour.

Maliadi.name: Maliadi
Maliadi.publicNotes: A maliadi resembles a massive hippopotamus surrounded by a collar of flame. Maliadis are arrogant and tyrannical, and demand tribute from everyone they encounter-whether lone travelers or entire villages-to avert destruction. Many pay them off, for maliadis can hurl parts of their flaming collars to form geysers of flame or fiery walls, and they're also powerful shapeshifters.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: The maliadi can hold its breath for 1 day.

Collar of Fire.name: Collar of Fire
Collar of Fire.description:
The maliadi has resistance 20 to physical ranged attacks, such as arrows, bolts, javelins, and thrown rocks, as such attacks are magically diverted through its collar of fire.

Nonmagical weapons and ammunition affected by this ability are incinerated and destroyed.

Counterspelling Wall.name: Counterspelling Wall
Counterspelling Wall.description:
触发 A creature within 100 feet of the maliadi that the maliadi can see Casts a Spell that targets the maliadi

效果 The maliadi casts one of its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire} spells, with a duration of 1 round.

If the spell that triggered this reaction passes through the wall of fire, the wall attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+28]]{+28}.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description:
The maliadi tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller.

The maliadi must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:35] check (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the maliadi) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The maliadi can take on the appearance of any Large, Huge, or Gargantuan animal. This doesn't change its Speed or Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

River Form.name: River Form
River Form.description: The maliadi takes on the form of a stretch of river, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.U0hL0LLaprcnAyzC]{Wind Walk}, except the maliadi can only affect itself, appears as a section of a flowing river that takes up the same space as the maliadi, and can't leave the ground.

Mamlambo.name: Mamlambo
Mamlambo.publicNotes:
Mamlambos are river predators with hypnotic, bioluminescent skin. They appear similar to crocodiles, but the narrow head at the end of their long necks resembles a horse's skull, and their four legs are stubby and inefficient for land movement. Their skin's green glow is only barely visible in daylight or when underwater, though the glow is difficult to resist. As a result, they're frequently trailed by fish, birds, or other river creatures ensnared by the alluring radiance.

Humanoids are mamlambos' favorite prey, particularly humans, although they strangely prefer to only eat their victims' faces and brains. Mamlambos are dim-witted but sly, and sometimes hide their victims under submerged rocks or logs to make their discovery less likely. A mamlambo might be active in a region for days or even weeks before its presence is discovered.

Luminous Lure.name: Luminous Lure
Luminous Lure.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The mamlambo emits dim light from its skin. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save. Humanoids take a -2 penalty to this saving throw.

Regardless of the save's result, the creature is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

失败 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and for as long as it is in the aura it must spend at least 1 of its actions on each of its turns to move closer to the mamlambo as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature ends its movement or turn adjacent to the mamlambo, it is Slowed 1 until it is out of the aura or until the mamlambo makes a Strike against it.

The target can attempt a new Will save at the beginning of each of their subsequent turns, and on a success, the effect ends.

大失败 As failure, but the creature must spend each of its actions moving closer to the mamlambo, and if it ends its movement or turn adjacent to the mamlambo, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} until it is out of the aura or until the mamlambo makes a Strike against it.

Attack of Opportunity.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Face Eater.name: Face Eater
Face Eater.description:

On a failure, the creature also takes an additional @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d6.success], or @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.success] on a critical failure.

Pygmy Kaava.name: Pygmy Kaava
Pygmy Kaava.publicNotes:
An unusually large number of kaava living in the Kaava Lands are relatively small, standing about 3 feet tall and weighing about 30 pounds. Pygmy kaava openly show their disdain for larger kaava, and the two groups rarely get along. Pygmy kaava often hunt alongside trained bush vipers or black mamba snakes.

Kaava are stealthy, jungle-dwelling humanoids with short down feathers that can easily be mistaken for fur from a distance. Kaava have tough scales beneath these feathers. Both the scales and feathers have mutable pigmentation that allows a kaava to blend into surrounding foliage like a chameleon.

Trackless.name: Trackless
Trackless.description: A kaava moving at half their Speed or less steps so lightly that they leave virtually no trace. The DCs of checks to Track a kaava are increased by 10.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: A kaava ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

Rompo.name: Rompo
Rompo.publicNotes:
Rompos are unusual creatures that feed on corpses. They have thin, almost-skeletal bodies with strong rear legs that resemble a bear's, front legs like a badger's, and a head like a hare's with humanoid ears. A rompo tends to be timid on its own; it avoids other creatures and typically flees in the presence of larger animals. Though no more intelligent than any other beast, it usually acts with extreme paranoia, dodging traps or ambushes with an uncanny acumen. When danger is present, a rompo utters a loud cry to afford itself space to run and hides by using its body's natural color-shifting fur as camouflage.

Although rompos sport the perfect physical features to act as predators, they tend to live their lives as solitary scavengers of leftover corpses. Rompos prefer to avoid hunting for themselves since they risk sustaining injuries in the process. It's not uncommon for rompos to follow other predators for hours, waiting for an opportunity to feast on the leftover remains of a hunt.

Once a rompo gains access to a meal, it takes several minutes circling the corpse to make sure the area is clear. As it begins to feast, it lets out a whimpering cry that fascinates and compels other creatures to keep away so that the rompo can feed in peace. Due to its constant feeding on decaying flesh, a rompo's mouth is filled with rot, parasites, and deadly pathogens. Its bite can impart these combined infections as a dangerous disease known as rompo chills. The disease causes its victim to tremble uncontrollably, lightly at first but eventually developing into a violent shaking that ends with the victim's death. Despite their cautious nature, rompos always seem to linger close to creatures they infect with rompo chills; though they remain unseen while the victim lives, they emerge when that victim finally succumbs, in order to feed on the corpse.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The rompo can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to Hide with a Stealth check.

Crooning Cry.name: Crooning Cry
Crooning Cry.description:
60 feet.

The rompo hums in a low voice. Each creature within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} and compelled to move away from the rompo, traveling to the furthest edge of the emanation. Fascinated creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}.

The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the rompo spends a single action on subsequent rounds, it can extend the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. If the rompo attacks, the fascinated condition ends only for the creature that is attacked.

On a successful save, a creature is temporarily immune to Crooning Cry for 24 hours.

Sié Goluo.name: Sié Goluo
Sié Goluo.publicNotes:
Sié Goluo, sometimes referred to simply as Grandfather, is an ancient spirit that has kept watch over the peoples of the Mwangi Expanse for generations. Most believe he first appeared during the Age of Darkness to protect the Mwangi people from the worst dangers of the everlasting night. Bekyar storytellers claim he is older still, from a time before the first people walked Golarion. This immortal spirit has incarnated into multiple forms over millennia. In the oldest surviving tales, they say Sié Goluo looked like an ordinary-if oversized-ox, save for his nearly human-looking eyes. Most recently, people say he has the appearance of several different animals, but accounts vary on which animals make up his form.

When a traveling farmer is assailed by a deadly beast, or a small village faces the wrath of an advancing army, Sié Goluo manifests in whatever form will allow him to best defend them. There seem to be no geographical limitations on where he can manifest, as there are tales of him saving Mwangi adventurers as far spread as Tian Xia and Arcadia.

Spirit Steps.name: Spirit Steps
Spirit Steps.description: Sié Goluo ignores difficult terrain and doesn't trigger traps with his movement.

Ancestral Response.name: Ancestral Response
Ancestral Response.description:
触发 A creature on the Material Plane calls out for Sié Goluo

效果 Sié Goluo instantaneously appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the triggering creature and heals [[/r (8d8)[healing]]]{8d8 Hit Points} on all allies that can see him within 60 feet. Allies healed this way gain a +2 circumstance bonus on saving throws for 1 minute.

Creatures that receive these benefits become temporarily immune to them for 1 year.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.gxBjyPaYDdhjAImf]{效果: Ancestral Response}

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Sié Goluo is destroyed, he reforms, fully healed, at a location of his choosing anywhere on the Material Plane after [[/r 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days}. If every person of Mwangi descent rejects belief in Sié Goluo, the spirit is permanently destroyed.

Spirit Charge.name: Spirit Charge
Spirit Charge.description:
Sié Goluo Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. On a hit, Sié Goluo creates a shock wave that deals [[/r (4d12)[force]]]{4d12 force damage} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save).

Creatures that fail their save are pushed away 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

Solar Ibis.name: Solar Ibis
Solar Ibis.publicNotes:
Solar ibis are beings of light sometimes called sun birds, or "winged luminaries" by the more scholarly inclined. They're tasked with guarding sacred places or items, although they sometimes also protect the living from places of incredible danger. Their appearance is always preceded by numerous small purple-winged birds with a splash of yellow on their crowns; these are avatars of the ibis that nest and congregate in areas it protects. The presence of these avatars is often the only way to track these reclusive and solitary creatures. Should the solar ibis choose to appear, these little birds scatter like wild fowl. The sun bird then manifests and bathes the area in a brilliant shower of light that can blind and startle unwary and unprepared creatures in its presence.

The solar ibis appears as a magnificent, large bird surrounded by a halo of brilliant light. Its black feathers shimmer with all the colors of the spectrum, casting glossy rainbows across its plumage. It has a keen sense of insight, which it uses to pass judgment as a whole on whether those before it are worthy to access what it guards. It punishes those it finds unworthy with its cleansing might.

Though considered sacred by most within the Mwangi Expanse, there are still some who hunt these glorious creatures; some seek the treasures that the ibis keep, while others seek the ibis themselves, dead or alive. Some believe that the feathers of a solar ibis, when burned, create an incense that can grant holy power to those that inhale it. Others believe that its bones and feet can be ground into a powder that can destroy demons and purify the undead.

Blinding Halo.name: Blinding Halo
Blinding Halo.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The solar ibis's halo sheds bright light. Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute. A creature that critically fails its save is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.

Creatures who successfully save are temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.

The solar ibis can extinguish or resume the halo's light as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: When a solar ibis succeeds at a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.

Ibis Dive.name: Ibis Dive
Ibis Dive.description: The solar ibis Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descends at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon Strike.

Light Shatter.name: Light Shatter
Light Shatter.description:
The solar ibis detonates its halo, sending shards of burning light in all directions that deal [[/r (6d8)[fire]]]{6d8 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save). The shards deal an extra [[/r (6d8)[good]]]{6d8 good damage} against fiends and undead.

The solar ibis cant use Light Shatter again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]] rounds, and its Blinding Halo is extinguished during this time. The halo is restored automatically once the [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} have passed.

Zinba.name: Zinba
Zinba.publicNotes:
Commonly known as ghost serpents, zinbas are rare, amphibious snakes with healing abilities. They're of similar size to other large snakes, such as pythons, but have a distinct bright blue coloring with red-and-black patterned stripes along their backs. This distinct coloration is easy to spot, but zinbas can swim through the wet mud and soft earth of their homes to avoid being tracked by all but the most skilled pursuers. This elusiveness inspires their "ghost serpent" moniker.

A zinba can metabolize a unique additive for its venom that converts it from a deadly poison to a healing agent, which makes zinbas particularly valuable in the eyes of healers and poachers. There is a high demand for zinbas in many markets; live serpents fetch a hefty sum, but zinba eggs are especially valuable, as zinbas reared in captivity are less willful and more likely to eat in confinement. Their elusiveness, however, leads many to search for their dens instead, which are large pools of water among remote wetlands or underground hollows near bodies of water. The water of a zinba's pool also has minor but valuable healing qualities, but removing water from a den causes it to lose its healing properties after a few hours, so most who find a den attempt to immediately make use of it.

Even finding dens is a difficult prospect, since zinbas are particularly intelligent for animals and can recognize signs of travelers near their favored hiding places. When there are signs of danger, a zinba collapses its lair and flees to create another den elsewhere.

Tighten Coils.name: Tighten Coils
Tighten Coils.description:
触发 A creature grabbed or restrained by the zinba attempts to Escape

效果 The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.

Slither.name: Slither
Slither.description: The zinba Strides, Climbs, or Swims up to half its Speed, pulling any creatures it has grabbed with it.

Zinba Restoration.name: Zinba Restoration
Zinba Restoration.description:
The zinba bites a creature within reach and delivers a restorative healing remedy instead of its venom. The creature takes [[/r (1)[piercing]]]{1 point of piercing damage}, but then gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing 5} for 1 minute.

In addition, the restorative attempts a counteract check against any poison or disease affecting the creature with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+22]]{+22}.

A creature that receives the restorative is temporarily immune to the zinba's restorative for 24 hours.

Zinba Venom.name: Zinba Venom
Zinba Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 [[/r (3d6)[poison]]]{3d6毒素伤害} (1轮)

阶段2 [[/r (4d6)[poison]]]{4d6毒素伤害}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}

Eloko.name: 鳄吻怪 Eloko
Eloko.publicNotes:
如果鳄吻精足够幸运，吞下几个施法者或拥有内在法术的生物，它将经历一次微小的变化，持续1周时间。这样的怪物被称为鳄吻怪。除了它们令人难以置信的胃口之外（甚至以鳄吻精的标准来看），它们还有变为巨大体型的超自然能力。

鳄吻精是长着鳄鱼嘴的精类，他们在芒吉莽原出没，以人类的肉为食。鳄吻精邪恶狡猾，他们使用致命的陷阱和游击狩猎战术来捕捉猎物——通常是倒霉的探险者或误入丛林的村民，他们中的许多人认为鳄吻精是残忍的先祖之魂。这些生物中最强大的被称为“鳄吻怪”，拥有强大的变形魔法。

鳄吻精对铃铛情有独钟，敲钟的声音往往预示着附近有鳄吻精出没。除了在外出打猎时携带和敲响铃铛外，鳄吻精有时还会用强大的魔法为铃铛附魔，或者将铃铛挂在绳子上作为营地的警报器。

鳄吻精看起来像细长但结实的类人生物，有着鳄鱼般的脑袋、铁锈色的皮肤和血红色的眼睛。他们只吃人形生物的肉，并且他们只吃一顿就能存活很长时间，这要归功于他们像蛇一样吞下整个中型人形生物的能力。他们会松开下颚骨，然后把受害者从头到脚慢慢吞下。多亏了他们酸性的唾液和锋利的牙齿，鳄吻精可以将食物咀嚼成易于消化的肉糜，甚至在吞咽时也能将肉和骨头磨成浓缩的糊状物；因此，它们在吞食两倍或三倍于自身大小的食物时不会犹豫。

刚饱餐一顿的鳄吻精很容易通过肿胀下坠的腹部识别出来。然而，尽管它们此时看起来移动缓慢，但危险性也不亚于平时，因为它们钟情于杀戮，并且可能有饥饿的同伴躲在附近等待另一顿大餐。

Inspired Feast.name: 盛宴 Inspired Feast
Inspired Feast.description:
如果鳄吻怪花费1分钟以上的时间来吞食一具人类尸体，他们的攻击骰获得+1状态加值，伤害骰获得+2状态加值，持续1小时。

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.EM0VP31B8CyjFD15]{效果：盛宴}

Size Alteration.name: 体型增大 Size Alteration
Size Alteration.description: 鳄吻怪受到4环@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{变巨术 Enlarge}效果影响，该效果持续1分钟，并且鳄吻怪可以主动解除效果。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
鳄吻怪对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}的生物额外造成2d6精准伤害。
